page.title: 13Shopping Customs
page.content: When shopping many people prefer smaller shops in the village or the mobile shops which travel round the houses. They like them because you can talk to people and get to know the shopkeepers. In Kirkfieldbank there are two general stores an there is a newsagents which also sells food. All the shops in the village give a friendly service and two are open on Sundays. However, most people when shopping for their weekly groceries go to Lanark by bus or car to the supermarkets there. For clothes or larger household purchases most families would travel the twelve miles to the more populous area of Hamilton, Motherwell or Wishaw. Some people would even go as far as Glasgow or Edinburgh in order to find the exact item they are looking for. Local people also shop by post.
